definition: strip/item/article/clause (of law or treaty)/classifier for long thin things (ribbon, river, road, trousers etc)
item/component/classifier for events, things, clothes etc
contrary/in reverse/inside out or upside down/to reverse/to return/to oppose/opposite/against/anti-/to rebel/to use analogy/instead/abbr. for 反切[fan3 qie4] phonetic system

sentences.english: I spent a little time researching habits and reflecting on my own experience.
sentences.chinese: 我花了一小段时间来研究我自己的习惯和条件反射。

sentences.english: What this comes down to is classical Pavlovian conditioning.
sentences.chinese: 这个现象还可以联系到经典条件反射。

sentences.english: I got very nervous at the whistle. This is knee-jerk reaction.
sentences.chinese: 听到哨音，我感到非常紧张，这已经成为了条件反射。

sentences.english: This helps satisfy the urge to place one thing in your mouth.
sentences.chinese: 剥开口香糖的动作甚至可以成为举起香烟的条件反射。

sentences.english: Putin's world view is reflexively anti-western.
sentences.chinese: 普金有条件反射式的反西方的世界观。

sentences.english: The basic philosophy that I ascribe to is operant conditioning.
sentences.chinese: 训练的基本理念，我归结为是操作条件反射。

sentences.english: Even you don't know Pavlov's dog!
sentences.chinese: 你甚至不知道巴甫洛夫的条件反射学吗？

sentences.english: The electric maze indicator had positive correlation with P3-like potentials.
sentences.chinese: 正常大鼠类P3与电迷宫条件反射有相关性。
这就是操作性条件反射。

sentences.english: I did a lot of this type of mental conditioning during the early 90s.
sentences.chinese: 在90年代早期，我建立过大量的心理条件反射。

definition: to act without taking time to think (idiom); to react instantly/to fire from the hip
